results.name: Number of ways to write n^2 as x^2 + y^2 + z^2 + w^2 with x,y,z,w nonnegative integers and z <= w such that 2*x or y is a power of 4 (including 4^0 = 1) and x + 63*y = 2^(2k+1) for some k = 0,1,2,....
comment: This is stronger than the conjecture that A300360(n) > 0 for all n > 1. Note that a(387) = 3 < A300360(387) = 4 and a(1774) = 1 < A300360(1774) = 2.
We have verified that a(n) > 0 for all n = 2..10^7.
See also A299537, A299794 and A300219 for similar conjectures.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
